title: [fix](routine-load) pause job when json path is invalid
body:
## Proposed changes

If jsonpaths is set wrong, routine load job will report error but running all time.For example:
```
CREATE ROUTINE LOAD jobName ON tableName
PROPERTIES
(
    "format" = "json",
    "max_batch_interval" = "5",
    "max_batch_rows" = "300000",
    "max_batch_size" = "209715200",
    "jsonpaths" = "[\'t\',\'a\']"
)
FROM KAFKA
(
    "kafka_broker_list" = "$IP:PORT",
    "kafka_topic" = "XXX",
    "property.kafka_default_offsets" = "OFFSET_BEGINNING"
);
```

Jsonpaths [\'t\',\'a\'] is invalid, but job will running all time.

<!--Describe your changes.-->

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [improvement](function) switch inet(6)_aton alias origin function
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

Functions related:
- inet_aton
- inet6_aton
- is_ipv4_compat
- is_ipv4_mapped



<!--Describe your changes.-->

Before this PR,  **inet(6)_aton** is an alias of **ipv4(6)_string_to_num** like Clickhouse, which will throw an **exception** while handling an **invalid IP address** input.
![image](https://github.com/apache/doris/assets/42577861/9de31d38-6489-4cfe-9b38-6d9e0199d7ee)



However, in MySQL, inet(6)_aton prefers to ignore the exception and return **NULL**. What's more, two functions, is_ipv4_compat and is_ipv4_mapped in MySQL both nest inet6_aton and return NULL as well.
![image](https://github.com/apache/doris/assets/42577861/f89fee14-a2bb-4eac-94e5-fcd52205bdd9)




In this PR, after Doris Community's discussion, in order to be more compatible with Clickhouse and MySQL, we switch inet(6)_aton alias origin function **from ipv4(6)_string_to_num to ipv4(6)_string_to_num_or_null**, so that these 4 functions will return NULL with the **invalid IP address** input.
![image](https://github.com/apache/doris/assets/42577861/cd9f5c4a-96d0-4833-a0c0-d0b76b6c7a8f)

Meanwhile, If users still want to have an **exception** while handling the **invalid IP address** input, we suggest  **directly using ipv4(6)_string_to_num**.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by one committer.

title: [fix](datatype) fixed decimal type implicit cast handling in BinaryPredicate
body:
## Proposed changes

Implicit type cast for binary predicate was not handled for decimal types correctly in **OriginalPlanner** (Neredis planner already handles this case as part of BindExpression),
It only compared primitive type without specialization on the scale and precision. leading to wrong result.

Issue Number: close #30103 

Added full Type compare instead of PreimitiveType compare to apply cast.

![image](https://github.com/apache/doris/assets/66766227/d53e84dc-6adb-4bb8-8ab2-90071d09fad4)

title: [Fix](Variant) fix variant lost null info after `cast_column`
body:
This could result incorrect output in hirachinal cases

```
sql """insert into ${table_name} values (-3, '{"a" : 1, "b" : 1.5, "c" : [1, 2, 3]}')"""
sql """insert into  ${table_name} select -2, '{"a": 11245, "b" : [123, {"xx" : 1}], "c" : {"c" : 456, "d" : "null", "e" : 7.111}}'  as json_str
            union  all select -1, '{"a": 1123}' as json_str union all select *, '{"a" : 1234, "xxxx" : "kaana"}' as json_str from numbers("number" = "4096") limit 4096 ;"""

mysql> select v["c"] from var_rs where k = -3 or k = -2;
+----------------------+
| element_at(`v`, 'c') |
+----------------------+
| [1,2,3]              |
| []                   |
+----------------------+
2 rows in set (0.04 sec)
```

## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

title: [opt](nereids) do not change RuntimeFilter Type from IN-OR_BLOOM to BLOOM on broadcast join
body:
## Proposed changes
1. do not change RuntimeFilter Type from IN-OR_BLOOM to BLOOM on broadcast join
    tpcds1T, q48 improved from 4.x sec to 1.x sec
2. skip some redunant runtime filter
    example: A join B on A.a1=B.b and A.a1 = A.a2
    RF B.b->(A.a1, A.a2)
    however, RF(B.b->A.a2) is implied by RF(B.a->A.a1) and A.a1=A.a2
    we skip RF(B.b->A.a2)
Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->

title: [fix](routine-load) check offset when schedule tasks
body:
## Proposed changes

If I set offset out of Kafka offset range, routine load job running all the time and do not report any error, 
for example(max offset in Kafka is 2):
```
CREATE ROUTINE LOAD XXX
COLUMNS TERMINATED BY "|"
PROPERTIES
(
    "max_batch_interval" = "5",
    "max_batch_rows" = "300000",
    "max_batch_size" = "209715200"
)
FROM KAFKA
(
    "kafka_broker_list" = "IP:PORT",
    "kafka_partitions" = "0",
    "kafka_topic" = "multi_table_load_invalid_table",
    "kafka_offsets" = "100"
);
```

It is necessary to check offset before schedule tasks.

<!--Describe your changes.-->

title: [fix](move-memtable) only do close wait on the last sink
body:
## Proposed changes

If data distribution is not balanced among all sinks, some sink may finish very fast while others are still writing.
The fast sinks may wait a long period of time and trigger close_wait timeout.

This PR changes this behavior, the first N-1 sinks will not wait for stream close.
Only the last one will do close wait and handle commit info.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [fix](injection) don't disturb CLOSE_LOAD message in LoadStream
body:
## Proposed changes

Although it's OK to disturb CLOSE_LOAD message in LoadStream,
doing so will also make these cases run very slow (till close wait timeout).

This PR removes fault injection to CLOSE_LOAD message.
Missing CLOSE_LOAD will only be tested in cases for close_wait timeout. 

## Further comments

title: [fix](statistics)Reanalyze olapTable if getRowCount is not 0 and last time row count is 0.
body:
Sample analyze may write 0 result if getRowCount is not updated while analyzing. So we need to reanalyze the table if getRowCount > 0 and previous analyze row count is 0. Otherwise the stats for this table may stay 0 for ever before user load new data to this table.

title: [fix](chore) path gc should consider tablet migration
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

Background:
1. Migration will create new tablet in different DataDir, the old tablet will be moved to TabletManager::_shutdown_tablets.
2. The migration task won't copy data in stale rowsets to new tablet, so after migration, the new tablet don't contains stale rowsets of old tablet
3. The path GC process will check every path, to make sure if it's an useless tablet, or an useless rowset. If it is, will remove data of these tablets/rowsets

The issue:
1. When path GC got a stale rowset path from the data dir of old tablet, it extract the tablet id and rowset id
2. Then it check if the tablet id exists in TabletManager, and the answer is YES!
3. It got the tablet instance, which is the new tablet, then it check if the stale rowset id from the old tablet path exists in the new tablet instance, and got the answer NO.
4. The path GC process treat the rowset as an useless rowset, since it can't find anyone holds reference to it, then delete  the data of this stale rowset.
5. But some query may still holds reference to this stale rowset, the deletion will cause query failure.

Solution:
1. The lifecycle of all rowsets in a shutdown tablet, should be related with the lifecycle of this tablet
2. We need to differentiate the old tablet and the new one created by migration task, while performing path GC.


## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [fix](Nereids): eliminate redundant join condition after inferring condition
body:
## Proposed changes

eliminate redundant join when find hashing join condition
such as for plan:
```
T1 join T2 on T1.id = T2.id join T3 on T1.id = T3.id and T2.id = T3.id 
```
we infer a new predicate T1.id = T2.id which is redundant. Therefore we need to eliminate it when find hash condition
